Articles.Content:
Hey, just joined, have had the demo for a week or so now and just 5 minutes ago, I made a non KAI landing on the moon:

A mixture of terrible landing site planning and only having the demo made it impossible to land upright.

I had 1.3 tanks left so I might have been able to make a clever escape had I landed correctly, but I doubt it.

Any words for my first landing?

~Wild_Doogy
welcome aboard! and for the landing: if they are alive, it's a success

welcome aboard! and for the landing: if they are alive, it's a success

I was hoping to have them land back on Kerbin though......

Well, next time....

~Wild_Doogy

Welcome to the forums and congratulations on your landing!

It's pretty common here to regard any landing you survive to be a good one, seeing as many find it difficult to even get to another body. Keep going at it and you'll be making round-trips in no time! Enjoy your stay here on the forums!

- Your Friendly Neighborhood Moderator (In a Spider Suit)

Radion

2/2 successful trips to the moon and back so far.

~Wild_Doogy

Well done wild_doogy, and welcome to the community

When you get the alpha release, you'll have the brand new challenge of landing on Minmus, and more planets are coming

As a college student with a tight wallet, I am waiting a bit before I purchase the game.

I have shown it to my space obsessed physics professor and he said he might end up using it for class at some point.

~Wild_Doogy
That would be brilliant wild_doogy, here is the contact page for Squad, your physics professor could drop the devs an email
